results.title: Project the right image
results.brief_description:
English production, NOT made by the Department of Agriculture.

Details hot to and how not to project a 16mm film using a social church gathering as the backdrop. Stars a bumbling projectionist and a priest who first do everything the wrong way and then do everything the correct way.

Comical (in a daggy way) throughout with good use of slapstick humour. Also contains an amusing, very dry voiceover.

results.title: Dirty Harry
results.brief_description:
‘Harry She’llberight’ is a lazy farmer, stuck in the ‘old ways’ of chemical spraying. He provides a ‘worst case scenario’ of chemical spray use. A representative of the Vistorian Department of Agriculture assists Harry in modern spraying techniques, equipment and safety. Along the way we are introduced to different spray epuipment and how it operates away from Harry’s farm.

Harry is a comical character and he eventually gets his act together as the film progresses.

Opening contains nice shots of people picking lettuce and scens inside of a vegetable market.

Good cartoon-like illustrations about chemical spraying safety.

results.title: A Continent on guard
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Bob Walker
results.brief_description: Presents a dramatic, simulated investigation into a suspected outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Australia, and points out what measures would be taken to eradicate the disease. Note: A complementary production to ‘The constant threat’
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Bob Walker

results.title: Tractor driving
results.brief_description: Very clearly this film gives hints on the maintenance, driving and safety precautions to be taken with a tractor. “A well maintained machine will be a safer machine and give you better value over its work life.”

results.title: Fred's Films. [Luna Park] [excerpt]
results.brief_description: Filmed in the mid 1960s by steam train enthusiast and home movie maker Fred Daley who captures a family outing to the popular sea-side amusement park in St Kilda. ‘Luna Park’ is shown in all its summertime glory with the ‘River Boats’, the ‘Dodgems’, the ‘Rotor’ (a washing spin cycle for humans!), ‘The Spinner’ and of course its famous wooden roller coasters, the ‘Big Dipper’ and the ‘Scenic Railway’. Courageous Fred even films during the ride where you catch a glimpse of Port Phillip Bay from the very top!

Courageous Fred even films during the ride where you catch a glimpse of Port Phillip Bay from the very top!

results.title: Car park
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Leesa Kahn and Darcy Yuille

results.title: Placement
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Sarah Warner and Bill Chen
results.brief_description:
Sometime in the future, Max lives with his only daughter, Ruby, in an apartment complex where he spends all his time working. But his life is shattered when Ruby chases her balloon off the edge and falls to the street below.
He is offered the chance to clone her and puts his strong religious beliefs aside in order to have his daughter back, but the new Ruby is not the same.
